samples.question: [Transcript chunk 4]
samples.transcript: Employer yes how can employers motivate their staff if it was not a toxic atmosphere how can employees motivate their stuff well i think there are a lot of ways that employer can motivate their employees i think transparent communication plays a very big role what is also crucial is genuine feedback to your employees and employee recognition yeah yeah also in my opinion financial incentives is important as well saying that do you think that money is the most important motivating motivating factor at work well i think it depends on like on individuals for some yes i would say money empowers them a lot but for the others what motivates them in the workplace the most could be probably like a creative or friendly working environment by that yeah exactly by that i mean maybe as an employer you always show respect to your employees always encourage them yeah and you include them in the decision-making process and let their voices be heard yeah so okay so now we are talking about leaders they are more male leaders than female do you think this will change in the future well sadly to be honest i do not think it would change in the future and that being said i did not mean that I am against it or anything or there is anything wrong with it but i think gender inequality has something to do with it it is always been a problem and i do not think it is going to be so soon in the future unfortunately lately yeah so what what inspires people to be leaders in the first place why why do people want that power it is possible that they want to be in charge and not vice versa and by that i mean being under control of other people another reason for.

samples.question: [Transcript chunk 2]
samples.transcript: Bills that I have to take care of every month electricity food groceries and now I actually have credit card debts can you believe that it is strange to finally be a grownup and do adult things like this but yeah I was not looking forward to paying bills like this at all but eventually it did come how do you usually pay your bills in cash or by another method I think that I am not just speaking for myself on this one but using cards or specifically banking apps on your phone has become a norm pretty much these days for not just young people like myself anymore even older people in my family or younger siblings of mine not siblings younger cousins of mine they have all started to get used to using cards or banking apps to make payments more efficiently and we only ever use cash if we absolutely have to or if we has or if we have cash lying around okay so have you ever forgotten to pay a bill I would not say forgotten I have definitely been slow to pay some certain bills especially my insurance because it does not really have any consequence if I forget to pay them on time but other than that every other kinds of bills have this system where they notifi notify me notify me 5 to 10 days in advance through emails or phone calls or texts so unfortunately I have never really forgotten to pay an important bills before okay is there anything you could do to make your bills cheaper buying less stuff is an obvious answer besides I think using less electricity or just be mindful when to turn on or off the.
